intro: Hedeoma ciliata, commonly known as the hairy leaf hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Hedeoma ciliata is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
